intro: Vrydagzynea celebica, commonly known as the Celebes vrydagzynea, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Vrydagzynea celebica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution in its native habitat.
